title: Sprengel Deformity: Gender Distribution in Medical Literature
short_description: Medical literature review examining conflicting reports on gender prevalence of Sprengel deformity.
long_description: This document discusses the varying reports in medical literature regarding the gender distribution of Sprengel deformity, a congenital shoulder blade malformation. While most medical reports indicate a 3:1 female-to-male ratio for this condition, other studies suggest equal prevalence between genders. This discrepancy in reported gender distribution highlights the need for further research and standardized data collection to establish accurate epidemiological patterns for Sprengel deformity.
